summary: Raised $40M in Series B to expand development of AI-powered neurostimulation devices targeting epilepsy and Parkinsonâ€™s.
Initiated Phase II trial for its wearable cardiac monitor in collaboration with Mayo Clinic.
Submitted 510(k) application to FDA for its robotic-assisted knee replacement system.
Hired VP of Regulatory Affairs, signaling preparation for international market expansion.
Secured $25M in Series A to accelerate development of AI-based diagnostic imaging platform.
Launched non-invasive pain therapy device in European markets after CE mark approval.
Completed enrollment for Phase I trial of its nanotech spinal implant system.
Filed for Health Canada approval of its autonomous surgical navigation platform.
Added Director of Clinical Strategy to support upcoming trial for its fetal monitoring system.
Closed $18M Series A to scale production of its smart infusion pump for home care.
